alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Covington; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:28PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Escambia, southeastern Conecuh and southwestern Covington Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 728 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of River Falls, or 13 miles southwest of Andalusia. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Escambia, southeastern Conecuh and southwestern Covington Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
